title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Cookies with Store Bought Dough

steps.headline: Buy a package of  pre-made cookie dough.
Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF(make sure you take out anything that was in the oven).
Cut slices of dough ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick.
steps.description: Line the cookie tray with aluminum foil, parchment paper, flour, or a type of Pam spray on the tray itself to prevent the dough from sticking.

steps.headline: Place the cookie dough balls on the tray, evenly spaced.
steps.description: Make a full tray. Approximately 16, 20, or 24 cookies.

steps.headline: Put the tray in the oven after your oven beeps.
steps.description: Set the timer for 12 minutes (Be sure to read cookie dough package, as cooking times may vary).

steps.headline: When the timer beeps, indicating that your cookies are done, use an oven mitt to take out the cookie tray.

tyn: A roll or tub of cookie dough
text: Buy a package of  pre-made cookie dough.  Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF(make sure you take out anything that was in the oven).  Cut slices of dough ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick. Line the cookie tray with aluminum foil, parchment paper, flour, or a type of Pam spray on the tray itself to prevent the dough from sticking. Place the cookie dough balls on the tray, evenly spaced. Make a full tray. Approximately 16, 20, or 24 cookies. Put the tray in the oven after your oven beeps. Set the timer for 12 minutes (Be sure to read cookie dough package, as cooking times may vary). When the timer beeps, indicating that your cookies are done, use an oven mitt to take out the cookie tray.  Cool for 30 minutes  Serve and enjoy!
sentences: Buy a package of  pre-made cookie dough.
Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF(make sure you take out anything that was in the oven).
Cut slices of dough ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick.
Line the cookie tray with aluminum foil, parchment paper, flour, or a type of Pam spray on the tray itself to prevent the dough from sticking.
Place the cookie dough balls on the tray, evenly spaced.
Put the tray in the oven after your oven beeps.
Set the timer for 12 minutes (Be sure to read cookie dough package, as cooking times may vary).
When the timer beeps, indicating that your cookies are done, use an oven mitt to take out the cookie tray.
Cool for 30 minutes  Serve and enjoy!
